definitions: employ or adapt (something) for a use different from its original purpose

examples.text: the twelve stadiums would be reappropriated for housing

shortDefinitions: employ something for use different from its original purpose

definitions: adopt (a derogatory term) for use with a positive or neutral connotation

examples.text: they reappropriated and embraced the insult

shortDefinitions: adopt derogatory term for use with neutral connotation

definitions: reallocate (money or assets) originally devoted to a different purpose

examples.text: the council has control of the money and can reappropriate it if the need arises

definitions: reclaim or recover (something) for one's own use

examples.text: he did not reapproproate copyright when the revised version was published

shortDefinitions: recover something for one's own use
